page.title: 06FARMING IN UNSWORTH.
page.content: Back o'th Moss is the nearest farm to our school. The farm used to own 300 acres of land, until 500 houses, 2 schools, an old peoples home and a motorway, which runs right through the farm, were built. They now only own 150 acres, half of the amount they originally owned. Due to the lack of land they could not keep their dairy cows. On the farm they now own pigs, horses, goats, hens and chickens. They either breed their own animals or go to auction to buy them. The farm grows hay, corn, barley and potatoes, but on much of the farm the soil cover is too thin for crops so the farmer grazes his cattle. The name of the farm comes from being at the back of the moss.
